sentences.english: This is a revised version to the paper with same title.
sentences.chinese: 本文是对同名文章的修改稿。

sentences.english: In case of emergency, each student has a single one day extension on a draft or revision that she or he can take.
sentences.chinese: 有突发情况时，每人只能延期一天提交草稿或修改稿。

sentences.english: This is second revised version to a paper with same title .
sentences.chinese: 本文是对作者编写的同名文章的第二修改稿。

sentences.english: Inform the Research Administration Office when you've received the final version of edited manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 作者在收到最终版本的修改稿后需通知科研处。

sentences.english: I will be available to meet with you to discuss your drafts and revised essays.
sentences.chinese: 到时我可与你见面，讨论草稿和修改稿。

sentences.english: However, I would wellcome a new submission, where these issues are addressed and the shortcomings resolved.
sentences.chinese: 这也是据搞的一种吗还是让我改稿呢？

sentences.english: When correcting, pay close attention to the seventh and last paragraph in the translation.
sentences.chinese: 改稿时请密切注意译文的第七段，即最后一段。

sentences.english: Therefore, we would certainly understand if you would choose not to resubmit your manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们认为你可能选择不再提交你的修改稿。

sentences.english: Each essay will be submitted first, in draft form, and later, in a revised version.
sentences.chinese: 每篇文章先交草稿，再交修改稿。

sentences.english: I think the new version will be ready for our signatures this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 我想修改稿今天下午就可以出来供我们签字。

definition: first party (law)/see also 乙方[yi3 fang1]
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
